about-me.title: About me
about-me.travel:
I enjoy working on-site
with the team
about-me.remote: I'm also open to working remotely
about-me.text:
Hi! I'm Josh, 24 years old, and I've discovered my passion for programming. I genuinely enjoy watching an idea turn into reality step by step: it starts with a concept, followed by countless lines of code – along with challenges that I tackle with full motivation. What fascinates me most about frontend development is being able to instantly see the effects of my code and experience the entire creation process firsthand. The diversity of programming languages excites me, and I love constantly learning new things.
HTML, CSS/SCSS, JavaScript/TypeScript, and Angular form the foundation of my skillset. But I'm also very interested in languages like Java and Python – I'm always ready to expand my knowledge and work with them in the future.

I'm ready for the challenge of creating something exceptional – and making it a reality.

skills.title: Skill set
skills.text: At the moment, I'm primarily working with HTML, CSS/SCSS, JavaScript, TypeScript, and Angular – everything you need for modern web development. I'm also highly interested in Java and Python, and I plan to deepen my knowledge in both and apply them in future projects. I'm not only interested in what runs in the browser – desktop applications and other software projects are just as exciting to me.
skills.ptp: I’m also interested in the following languages:

projects.title: Projects
projects.text: Feel free to check out my projects and click through! I make sure everything not only looks great but also feels great to use – clean code, responsive designs, and a strong focus on user experience. Have fun exploring!
projects.project-one: A powerful task management tool inspired by the Kanban system. Organize your projects effortlessly via drag and drop, assign tasks to individual team members, and keep an overview at all times with clear categories.
projects.project-two: A fast-paced underwater adventure! Swim through dangerous depths, battle nasty enemies, and face the ultimate final boss: a ruthless killer whale. Use various attacks and power-ups – survive if you can.
projects.project-three: Catch them all – in style! A modern PokéDex with smart search, detailed view, and 493 Pokémon from the HeartGold/SoulSilver era. Discover, filter, and find your favorites at a glance.

contact.title: Ready to work together?
contact.text: Are you looking for someone who thinks ahead, learns alongside you, and helps shape the process? I bring technical understanding, a passion for clean code, and the drive to constantly grow – ideally as part of a new team or project. If my profile aligns with what you're looking for, I’d be happy to hear from you.
contact.name: What's your Name?
contact.email-error: Please enter a valid email address.
contact.privacy_policy_end: and agree to the processing of my data as outlined.

join.description-text: Task manager inspired by the Kanban system. Create and organize tasks using drag-and-drop functionality, and assign them to users and categories.
join.details-text: A short text describing your role or the workflow for this specific project. Give a recruiter insight into your knowledge and your ability to work independently or in a structured team setting.

sharkie.description-text: Sharkie is a lovingly designed 2D browser game with a unique underwater look. The player controls a small shark through various levels, avoids dangers, and defeats enemies with water attacks. The goal is to survive the level and collect as many points as possible. All graphics, animations, and designs were custom-made to create a cohesive gaming experience.
sharkie.details-text: Developed using HTML5, CSS, and JavaScript with the Canvas element. The game mechanics are based on object-oriented programming with classes for game logic, animation, and controls. Keyboard inputs handle movement and attacks. This project showcases my knowledge in game logic, animation, and clean code structure.

pokedex.description-text: This Pokédex is a user-friendly web application for browsing and viewing Pokémon. Users can search by name and get a clear detail view with all relevant information. The entire app is built in German.
pokedex.details-text: The Pokédex was developed using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Data is dynamically fetched via the PokeAPI. An overlay view provides detailed information for each Pokémon, including navigation. The search function activates after entering three letters and covers up to 493 Pokémon. This project was part of my frontend development training and demonstrates my skills in working with APIs, DOM manipulation, and UI design.
